issue.title: [R][Release] Build of ubuntu-docs is failing
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-12909](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12909). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I am getting an error when building the image `ubuntu-docs`:

```
#5 43.03 The following packages have unmet dependencies:
#5 43.29  r-base : Depends: r-recommended (= 4.0.5-1.2004.0) but 4.1.0-1.2004.0 is to be installed
#5 43.33 E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
```

This was triggered when running `dev/release/post-09-docs.sh 4.0.1` on master.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12909?focusedCommentId=17354975) by Nicola Crane (thisisnic):*
`[~jorgecarleitao]` - just wanted to double check if this is now resolved?  I was reading the dev mailing list and it looks like it might be?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12909?focusedCommentId=17355132) by Nicola Crane (thisisnic):*
Actually, had another look and looks like it was not.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12909?focusedCommentId=17355282) by Jonathan Keane (jonkeane):*
Issue resolved by pull request 10426
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/10426>
